newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends easier on dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends easier on dollar demand.

text.p: Demand for the U.S. dollar from major state-owned banks forced the Bangladesh taka to finish weaker at 43.7470/7495 to the dollar in interbank trading on Tuesday, dealers said.
The taka was quoted weaker at 43.7460/7500 per dollar in early trade and remained under pressure until the close as requirements from state-owned banks led to a short supply of the dollar.
Interbank call money rates closed flat at 6.5-7.5 percent.
